cardregister

Interface CardRegister

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Register

    public interface CardRegister
    This is an interface for outside objects to communicate with CardRegister package.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • createCard

        void createCard(java.lang.String[] content)
                throws CardRegisterExceptions.NullInputException,
                       CardRegisterExceptions.AlmostSameCardExistsException,
                       CardRegisterExceptions.CardAlreadyExistsException
        Creates a new Card to the register.
        Parameters:
        content - The text fields of the card to be created
        Throws:
        Control.CardRegisterExceptions.NullInputException - if no text field has content.
        Control.CardRegisterExceptions.AlmostSameCardExistsException - if the register decides the created card is similar to an existing one. There is no stone set rules for the similarity, to allow some cases be handled with only warning to the user.
        CardRegisterExceptions.CardAlreadyExistsException - if there are two cards exactly similar to each others. The word "exactly" doesn't have to mean exactly, for example this can be case insensitive. This should be thrown and handled when it is impossible to create the card with the given data.
        CardRegisterExceptions.NullInputException
        CardRegisterExceptions.AlmostSameCardExistsException

      • deleteCards

        void deleteCards(java.lang.String[][] toBeDeleted)
        For deleting cards from the register.
        Parameters:
        toBeDeleted - The content of the cards which are being deleted. First argument specifies the card and the second it's fields. Thus, when deleting two cards both having five fields the argument would be of form String[2][5].

      • editCard

        void editCard(java.lang.String[] oldData,
            java.lang.String[] newData)
              throws CardRegisterExceptions.NullInputException,
                     CardRegisterExceptions.AlmostSameCardExistsException,
                     CardRegisterExceptions.CardAlreadyExistsException
        Edits data of an already existing card.
        Parameters:
        oldData - the data of the card which is being edited. This is used to specify the card.
        newData - the data of the card once it is edited.
        Throws:
        Control.CardRegisterExceptions.NullInputException - if all the fields are empty.
        Control.CardRegisterExceptions.AlmostSameCardExistsException - if the card is sufficiently similar to an already existing card. It is up to implementor to decide whether this causes dismissal of the edit, or just a warning.
        Control.CardRegisterExceptions.CardAlreadyExistsException - if the edited card would be similar to an already existing card after the edit. This must be prohibited, since the data is used to identify cards.
        CardRegisterExceptions.NullInputException
        CardRegisterExceptions.AlmostSameCardExistsException
        CardRegisterExceptions.CardAlreadyExistsException

      • getCardData

        java.lang.String[][] getCardData()
        Retrieves card data. All the contents of the cards in the register will be returned as a string array, whose first dimension is the same as the number of the cards and the second is the number of text fields in a card.
        Returns:
        The content of the cards.

      • getCurrentFile

        java.io.File getCurrentFile()
        Tells which file the register is attached to. This is the file the register was last saved to or loaded from.
        Returns:
        the file attached to this register.

      • getFieldNames

        java.lang.String[] getFieldNames()
        Returns what are the labels of the text fields in a card. For example in a register of race horses, the labels could be {"Name", "Owner", "Fastest run"...}. These labels correspond in order all the data sent in and out the cardRegister. Thus it is safe to couple them with the retrieved data like this: fieldNames[0] ~ data[0][0], fieldNames[1] ~ data[0][1], fieldNames[2] ~ data[0][2],...
        Returns:
        the labels as an array of Strings.

      • getNameField

        int getNameField()
        Tells which text field is the name of the whole card. I.e. for race horses it would be natural to select the title of the card to be the horse's name. This methods tells what field contains the name of the horse.
        Returns:
        The name field's number.

      • load

        void load(java.io.File file)
          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Loads the card data from the specified file. About the format of the file, check @see CardStrorage.
        Parameters:
        file - The file from which the data is read.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the specified file does not exist.

      • needsToBeSaved

        boolean needsToBeSaved()
        Tells whether information is lost when the file is closed without saving. This can be used to warn the user before he closes the program or tries to load a new file.
        Returns:
        true if the register has changed since the last save, false otherwise.

      • reset

        void reset()
        Empties the register.

      • save

        void save()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Saves the register to the file set as current. When using this method it's advised to check that there really is a current file to save on.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the save fails.

      • search

        java.lang.String[][] search(java.lang.String[] searchWords)
        Used for detailed search of the register.
        Parameters:
        searchWords - The search words as an array of strings. Each string corresponds to a text field in a card.
        Returns:
        The contents of the cards satisfying the search. The first argument indicated the card and the second it's field's number.

      • searchAnyField

        java.lang.String[][] searchAnyField(java.lang.String searchWord)
        Searches the searchWord from any field of the cards.
        Parameters:
        searchWord - The word to be searched.
        Returns:
        The contents of the cards satisfying the search. The first argument indicated the card and the second it's field's number.

      • setCurrentFile

        void setCurrentFile(java.io.File file)
        Sets the register attached to the file for saving etc.
        Parameters:
        file - The file register will be attached to.
